verses.verse: But it came to pass<WH5571>, that when Sanballat heard<WH8085> that we built<WH1129> the wall<WH2346>, he was angry<WH2734>, and took great<WH7235> indignation<WH3707>, and mocked<WH3932> the Jews<WH3064>.

Hear<WH8085>, O our God<WH430>; for we are despised<WH939>: and turn<WH7725> their reproach<WH2781> upon their own head<WH7218>, and give<WH5414> them for a prey<WH961> in the land<WH776> of captivity<WH7633>:
And cover<WH3680> not their iniquity<WH5771>, and let not their sin<WH2403> be blotted out<WH4229> from before<WH6440> you<WH3707>: for they have provoked you to anger before the builders<WH1129>.
So built<WH1129> we the wall<WH2346>; and all the wall<WH2346> was joined together<WH7194> unto the half<WH2677> there<WH5971>: for the people had a mind<WH3820> to work<WH6213>.

But it came to pass<WH5571>, that when Sanballat, and Tobiah<WH2900>, and the Arabians<WH6163>, and the Ammonites<WH5984>, and the Ashdodites<WH796>, heard<WH8085> that the walls<WH2346> of Jerusalem<WH3389> were made up<WH724>, and that the breaches<WH6555> began<WH2490> to be stopped<WH5640>, then they were very<WH3966> angry<WH2734>,

Nevertheless we made our prayer<WH6419> unto our God<WH430>, and set<WH5975> a watch<WH4929> against them day<WH3119> and night<WH3915>, because of them<WH6440>.

And Judah<WH3063> said<WH559>, The strength<WH3581> of the bearers of burdens<WH5449> is fading<WH3782>, and there is much<WH7235> rubbish<WH6083>; so that we are not able<WH3201> to build<WH1129> the wall<WH2346>.

And our adversaries<WH6862> said<WH559>, They shall not know<WH3045>, neither see<WH7200>, until we come<WH935> in the middle<WH8432> among<WH8432> them<WH2026>, and kill them<WH4399>, and cause the work to cease<WH7673>.

And it came to pass<WH3064>, that when the Jews which lived<WH3427> by them<WH681> came<WH935>, they said<WH559> unto us ten<WH6235> times<WH6471>, From all places<WH4725> from where you shall return unto us they will be upon you<WH7725>.

Therefore set<WH5975> I in the lower<WH8482> places<WH4725> behind<WH310> the wall<WH2346>, and on the higher places<WH6706>, I even set<WH5975> the people<WH5971> after their families<WH4940> with their swords<WH2719>, their spears<WH7420>, and their bows<WH7198>.

And I looked<WH7200>, and rose up<WH6965>, and said<WH559> unto the nobles<WH2715>, and to the rulers<WH5461>, and to the rest<WH3499> of the people<WH5971>, Be not you afraid<WH3372> of them<WH6440>: remember<WH2142> the Lord<WH136>, which is great<WH1419> and terrible<WH3372>, and fight<WH3898> for your brothers<WH251>, your sons<WH1121>, and your daughters<WH1323>, your wives<WH802>, and your houses<WH1004>.

And it came to pass<WH341>, when our enemies heard<WH8085> that it was known<WH3045> unto us<WH430>, and God had brought<WH6565> their counsel<WH6098> to nothing<WH6565>, that we returned<WH7725> all of us to the wall<WH2346>, every one<WH376> unto his work<WH4399>.

And it came to pass from that time<WH3117> forth<WH2677>, that the half of my servants<WH5288> done<WH6213> in the work<WH4399>, and the other half<WH2677> of them held<WH2388> both the spears<WH7420>, the shields<WH4043>, and the bows<WH7198>, and the habergeons<WH8302>; and the rulers<WH8269> were behind<WH310> all the house<WH1004> of Judah<WH3063>.
